sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Motor Vehicle Theft Reporting Act.

sections.heading: Theft of motor vehicle; report to police.
sections.text:
If a motor vehicle in
the possession of a motor vehicle repair station is stolen, the operator of
the motor vehicle repair station shall, immediately upon discovering the theft,
report the theft to the police department or sheriff's department of the
jurisdiction in which the motor vehicle repair station is located. As soon as
possible after reporting the theft to the police department or sheriff's
department, the operator of the motor vehicle repair station shall notify the
customer whose motor vehicle was stolen of the theft.

sections.heading: Penalty.
sections.text:
A person who violates Section 10 of this Act is guilty
of a business offense and shall be fined not less than $501 and not more than
$1,000.
